job_title: Business Development Manager in São Paulo, São Paulo
pros: Fast learning environment, great for growth
cons: Not so many boundaries between personal and professional lives

job_title: Team Member in São Carlos, São Paulo
pros: Commuter Checks & Assistance. Company Social Events. Employee Assistance Program. Employee Discount. Free Lunch or Snacks. Gym Membership.
cons: Bastante puxado para quem faz faculdade

job_title: Team Leader Sales in São Paulo, São Paulo
pros: AIESEC in Brazil is a good place to start a corporate experience, it is a place with people looking to collaborate to do a good job. It also helps to develop skills and leadership in young people.
cons: AIESEC in Brazil is not neutral in relation to ideologies, it has a lot of indoctrination and with that it does not become an inclusive place.

job_title: Outgoing Exchange Member in Brasília, Federal District
pros: AIESEC is the world''s largest student driven organization and people who gets involved with this global organization has a unique opportunity to develop themselves and make a positive impact in the world. As a member of AIESEC’s Outgoing Exchange team, I had the opportunity, together with the other members, to create and implement a marketing plan to promote AIESEC and to convince higher education students to go on an international internship; participate in recruitment and selection process for potential exchange participants; mediate the dialogue between the students and the companies; organize activities to prepare culturally the students who is going abroad; stay in contact with them during their internship and develop strategies to stimulate them to get actively involved with AIESEC.

job_title: Sales Manager in Franca, São Paulo
pros: The best thing about working with AIESEC is the international networking you acquire. You will meet a lot of people from all over the world and have the opportunity to practice other languages, learn other cultures..
cons: It's a lot of work and you are not paid for it, so be sure you really like your job. Sometimes it can be quite stressful.

job_title: Exchange Director in Brasília, Federal District
pros: Good room for innovation, you learn a lot, and can get skills that are hard to get if in the private market if you don't have precious experience
cons: Thins change a lot, and not always for better, and a there is still a lot of room for improvement in quality and organization

pros: Good environment, great people, best platform to learn
cons: Sometimes it depends on yourself more than your leader

review_title: AIESEC is about leadership and purpose
job_title: Vice President IGV in Limeira, São Paulo
pros: Great place to develop leadership skills. Strong purpose driven NGO. Great place to learn language
